title: Media Spotlight
content: There’s going to be more “With Love, Meghan,” the Duchess of Sussex’s Netflix lifestyles series. Stephen A. Smith, the face of ESPN’s “First Take,” has reached a $100 million deal that will give him more leeway to talk about politics and do things outside the network. On Friday's Front Page: President Trump has granted significant tariff exemptions for goods from Canada and Mexico, President Trump is expected to issue an order to facilitate the closure of the Department of Education, and more. On Thursday's Front Page: President Trump has asserted U.S. expansion aspirations to take over the Panama Canal and Greenland, Maryland, Virginia and D.C. officials warn that downsizing the federal government would hurt the regional economy, and more. As it has with other government agencies, the Trump administration is moving swiftly to assert its vision at the Voice of America. As it does so, a question hangs in the air: Is the news organization's journalistic mission, which dates to World War II, in for some fundamental changes? On Wednesday's Front Page: President Trump told a joint session of Congress that Americans are regaining their confidence, tariffs on Canada, Mexico and China have prompted swift retaliation and ignited a trade war, and more. The long nightmare of servitude under the grimy bootheel of the Mid-Atlantic Sports Network appears, finally, to be nearly over for the Washington Nationals. On Tuesday's Front Page: President Trump said he will follow through with 25% tariffs on imported goods from Mexico and Canada, President Trump will double down on his "America First" agenda in front of a joint session of Congress, and more. The Nationals and Baltimore Orioles ended a legal fight over television rights dating to 2012 when Major League Baseball announced Monday that Washington will be freed from its deal with the Mid-Atlantic Sports Network after the upcoming season. On Wednesday's Front Page: Americans say President Trump has not fulfilled a promise to "immediately" lower grocery costs, a study shows approximately 20,000 more births among the states that restricted abortion after the fall of Roe v. Wade, and more. The Washington Post's famously left-wing editorial page will undergo an about-face under a dramatic policy change announced Wednesday by billionaire owner Jeff Bezos, prompting the resignation of the opinion editor. The White House announced Tuesday it will decide which news outlets cover the president as part of the "pool" allowed into news events in locations such as the Oval Office or trips on Air Force One that cannot accommodate the full press corps, taking that long-held power from the independent White House Correspondents' Association. On Tuesday's Front Page: French President Emmanuel Macron met with President Trump at the White House on the third anniversary of the Russia-Ukraine war, OPM says employees' response to an email about their work product is voluntary, and more. MSNBC host Rachel Maddow took on her own network for shaking up its prime-time lineup, saying the decision to scrap shows helmed by Joy Reid and other minority hosts "feels indefensible." The popular right-wing podcaster Dan Bongino has built a career of unleashing sometimes inflammatory rants against the media, Democrats and the federal government.

title: Higher Ground
content: American Jews who fled their Syrian homeland decades ago went to the White House this week to appeal to the Trump administration to lift sanctions on Syria that they say are blocking them from restoring some of the world’s oldest synagogues and rebuilding the country’s decimated Jewish community. Pope Francis entered his fourth week in the hospital with double pneumonia, increasingly handing off his day-to-day duties to cardinals as questions swirl about the near and long-term future of his papacy. Now that California Gov. Gavin Newsom has said that it's unfair for biological males to compete against female athletes, state Republicans are hoping he'll support their girls' sports bill. After six decades of devotion to the organ, Maestro Leo Kramer treats the instrument like an extension of himself. He doesn't even need to lay hands on it to hear in his mind how a song will sound. The Trump administration moved to drop a lawsuit Wednesday against Idaho that had been initiated by the Biden administration against the state over its abortion restriction law. The nation's largest teachers' union sued the Trump administration over its effort to erase diversity, equity and inclusion programs in education, arguing that the policy violates the First Amendment and infringes on academic freedom. The Catholic Church opened the solemn Lenten season leading to Easter on Wednesday without the participation of Pope Francis, who was in the third week of hospital treatment for double pneumonia. At age 90 and 95, this Catholic nun dynamic duo have been "peacefully and respectfully" fighting for immigrant rights for over 40 years. And they never take no for an answer. Pope Francis was resting Wednesday, the start of the solemn Lenten period leading up to Holy Week observances, after sleeping through the night with a ventilation mask as he undergoes hospital treatment for double pneumonia. Democrats, lose the gimmicks and grow up Trump must stand strong against the left’s rage Trump versus Biden’s speeches to Congress Does Russia want peace? title: Culture
content: Authorities in New Mexico revealed Friday that Academy Award-winning actor Gene Hackman and his pianist wife, Betsy Arakawa, died of natural causes, ending intense media speculation over their mysterious deaths in their Santa Fe home last month. There’s going to be more “With Love, Meghan,” the Duchess of Sussex’s Netflix lifestyles series. A pair of Prince George's County Public Schools students attending separate institutions died recently from the flu, PGCPS Superintendent Millard House II told families in a letter. A hawk swooped in and landed on a tree, then watched as Michele and Jeremy Davis mourned their murdered son at a vigil outside his high school. Polish abortion rights activists opened a center across from the parliament building in Warsaw on Saturday where women can go to have abortions with pills, either alone or with other women. When her daughter was diagnosed with a rare autoimmune disease in 2010, Amy Gleason attacked the challenge. A northern Virginia man who was arrested during a megachurch's Sunday services on suspicion that he was about to embark on a mass shooting has been convicted of a hate crime, according to federal prosecutors. Pope Francis continued his recovery from double pneumonia on Saturday as the Vatican machinery and Holy Year celebrations marched on without him, this weekend dedicated to the Catholic Church's volunteers. A tale of good versus evil played out on the large screen in the sanctuary of St. Paul's Lutheran church in Finland. Jesus was shown in robes with long hair and a beard, while Satan was dressed in more modern clothes but with a menacing frown and higher-pitched voice - all created by artificial intelligence. Director Robert Eggers' macabre masterpiece creeps from silver screens to home theaters in the 4K disc format in "Nosferatu." Oklahoma's top education official said he's teaming with country music singer Lee Greenwood in seeking donations to get $59.99 leather-bound "God Bless the USA" Bibles into classrooms throughout the state, after a legislative panel rejected his $3 million request to fund the effort. Attorneys general from 21 states are urging Congress to ban the Chinese artificial intelligence application DeepSeek over spying concerns. A growing number of prominent companies have scaled back or set aside the diversity, equity and inclusion initiatives that much of corporate America endorsed following the protests that accompanied the Minneapolis police killing of George Floyd, a Black man, in 2020. Across-the-board cuts at the Social Security Administration are prompting questions about how the benefits of millions of recipients may be affected. The U.S. military's classified mini space shuttle returned to Earth on Friday after circling the world for 434 days. Ricardo Scofidio, an architect who transformed an abandoned railway into New York City's popular High Line park and was among the first in his profession to win a MacArthur Foundation "genius grant," has died. He was 89 and had worked on museums, college buildings and other projects around the world. Measles is not often seen in the United States, but Americans are growing more concerned about the preventable virus as cases continue to rise in rural West Texas. Until recently, most Americans had never heard the term "seed oils," even though they've likely cooked with and consumed them for decades. title: Technology
content: Director Robert Eggers’ macabre masterpiece creeps from silver screens to home theaters in the 4K disc format in “Nosferatu.” The U.S. military’s classified mini space shuttle returned to Earth on Friday after circling the world for 434 days. A tale of good versus evil played out on the large screen in the sanctuary of St. Paul's Lutheran church in Finland. Jesus was shown in robes with long hair and a beard, while Satan was dressed in more modern clothes but with a menacing frown and higher-pitched voice - all created by artificial intelligence. Attorneys general from 21 states are urging Congress to ban the Chinese artificial intelligence application DeepSeek over spying concerns. A growing number of prominent companies have scaled back or set aside the diversity, equity and inclusion initiatives that much of corporate America endorsed following the protests that accompanied the Minneapolis police killing of George Floyd, a Black man, in 2020. Nearly two months after an explosion sent flaming debris raining down on the Turks and Caicos, SpaceX launched another mammoth Starship rocket on a test flight Thursday to release mock satellites into space. President Trump said Thursday that he will "probably" grant an extension on TikTok's deadline to find an American buyer or be banned in the United States. An appeals court rejected SpaceX's attempt to dismiss a lawsuit brought by the National Labor Relations Board that accused the company of illegally firing engineers critical of CEO Elon Musk. Much like all the upheaval shaking the world, the huge swings rocking Wall Street may feel far from normal. But, for investing at least, all this is typical. Amazon is testing artificial intelligence-aided dubbing for select movies and shows offered on its Prime streaming service. National security technology firm Peraton has been awarded a $12 billion support contract to help streamline the Defense Logistics Agency's operations. Defense contractor Lockheed Martin announced this week that its LM 400 multi-mission satellite bus will launch later this month as part of a technology demonstration. Twelve Chinese nationals - including mercenary hackers, law enforcement officers and employees of a private hacking company - have been charged in connection with global cybercrime campaigns targeting dissidents, news organizations, U.S. agencies and universities, the Justice Department says. NASA is switching off two science instruments on its long-running twin Voyager spacecraft to save power. A judge this week blocked Elon Musk's attempt to keep OpenAI from transitioning to a for-profit model but left the door open for a later trial. Eight leaders or members of a Chinese hacking company have been charged alongside two Chinese law enforcement officers in a global cyberespionage campaign that targeted dissidents, news organizations and U.S. agencies, the Justice Department announced Wednesday. Google is updating its ubiquitous search engine with the next generation of its artificial intelligence technology as part of an effort to provide instant expertise amid intensifying competition from smaller competitors. Democrats, lose the gimmicks and grow up Trump must stand strong against the left’s rage Trump versus Biden’s speeches to Congress Does Russia want peace? Time is running out for Congress to cement Trump’s border security gains

Join us as we attempt to understand Donald Trump’s second term – and try to stay sane while doing it. Nesrine Malik and Jason Okundaye deliver your weekly dose of Black life and culture from around the world Start the day with the top stories from the US, plus the day’s must-reads from across the Guardian An 11-part series of newsletters exploring why we often feel overwhelmed, and what can be done to avoid it. title: Fox Business News, Stock Quotes, Investment and Savings News
content: Quotes displayed in real-time or delayed by at least 15 minutes. Market data provided by Factset. Powered and implemented by FactSet Digital Solutions. Legal Statement. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed. ©2025 FOX News Network, LLC. All rights reserved. FAQ - New Privacy Policy                                            FOX Business correspondent Madison Alworth has the latest on the storylines surrounding the Amelia Concours d’Elegance. A city in southeastern Tennessee is drawing in homebuyers. That city is Chattanooga, nestled not far from the Tennessee-Georgia border. With the use of artificial intelligence proliferating, cybercriminals are becoming more sophisticated and convincing when they target victims during tax season. Joby Aviation is getting closer to offering electric air taxis to the traveling public. Users in Dubai will be able to test it out as soon as this year. A city in southeastern Tennessee is drawing in homebuyers. That city is Chattanooga, nestled not far from the Tennessee-Georgia border. Barstool Sports founder and President Dave Portnoy weighs in on the new tipping trend that has caused consumers to further squeeze their bank accounts. Joby Aviation is getting closer to offering electric air taxis to the traveling public. Users in Dubai will be able to test it out as soon as this year. Boxing legend Floyd Mayweather joined FOX Business' 'Making Money' to discuss his $400 million real estate portfolio, his thoughts on President Donald Trump and more. President Trump praised the Treasury Department late Sunday for its recent decision to suspend enforcement of the Beneficial Ownership Information reporting requirements. Home prices are lowering, and rates are down, but renting is still cheaper than buying in most areas of the country. Palm Beach and West Palm Beach, two cities in sunny South Florida, have been experiencing a very active real estate market. Fanatics and Boardroom have partnered to build a networking platform for athletes in their business career following their playing days. Apple on Tuesday announced the latest iPad Air models. The tablets, which are lighter and thinner than the traditional iPad, will officially hit the market on March 12. Home prices are lowering, and rates are down, but renting is still cheaper than buying in most areas of the country. OpenAI founder Sam Altman's first post of 2025 was a poem about technological singularity, raising concerns and questions about the future of AI and human civilization. The Trump admin's federal funding freeze will not impact individual assistance going directly to Americans, Karoline Leavitt said during her first press briefing. The Agency founder and CEO Mauricio Umansky weighs in on housing prices and says that they will not go down. Balances for 401(k) retirement accounts hit the “second-highest average on record" in the final quarter of 2024, according to new data from Fidelity Investments. A New York Federal Reserve survey published on Monday found that many American consumers expect inflation to remain abnormally high in the coming years. SpaceX on Thursday afternoon launched its eighth suborbital flight test of its fully integrated Starship rocket, after a failed January test, at Starbase in Boca Chica Beach, Texas. Joby Aviation is getting closer to offering electric air taxis to the traveling public. Users in Dubai will be able to test it out as soon as this year. Netflix's 'Owning Manhattan' star and commercial real estate expert Jade Shenker told Fox News Digital why she believes this one side of the market is 'like a giant Black Friday sale.' Investigators with the U.S. Department of Justice are looking into the cause of skyrocketing egg prices across the country as the government seeks to lower costs. When the Kansas City Chiefs and Philadelphia Eagles hit the field Sunday for Super Bowl LIX, it will be a matchup of two multi-billion-dollar NFL teams. Yum Brands' Taco Bell showcased in New York City this week how it is utilizing artificial intelligence technology in its restaurants across the world. Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff spoke to the San Francisco Chronicle about his support for President-elect Donald Trump before and after the 2024 election. American refineries and consumers as well as Canadian producers would share in the financial burden of President Trump's pending 10% tariffs on Canadian oil, S&P Global found. Taylor Swift's "The Eras Tour" earned $2 billion in gross ticket sales, according to The New York Times. Swift took the stage for the final time on Dec. 8 in Vancouver. title: Fox Nation: Start Your Free Trial | Shows, Documentaries, & Specials
content:
Explore fresh perspectives from entertainment icons. Find exclusive new series from your favorite personalities and revisit the ones you already love. Get VIP access to live events – right from your living room. Watch on your TV, smart phone, tablet or our website. Stream commercial-free (except for Live TV). Download shows and movies to watch offline. Where can I watch FOX Nation? FOX Nation is available on your favorite streaming devices, you can watch on Roku, Apple TV, Samsung Smart TV, Amazon FireTV, Android TV, Vizio Smart TV, and LG Smart TV, for a full list click here. Can I watch FOX News with my FOX Nation subscription? You can watch the very best of Primetime On Demand along with some limited Fox News shows. To watch all Live Fox News shows, you will need to sign in with your TV Provider through Fox Nation, click here for additional info.
Note: A Fox Nation subscription does not include watching Fox News without a TV provider. How do I cancel FOX Nation? You can cancel anytime, go to the website or the app store where you purchased FOX Nation to cancel your subscription. What is your refund policy? Refunds are on a case by case basis. Please visit our support site and select Chat With an Expert. Our customer support team is available Mon-Fri 6AM-8PM PT and Sat-Sun 7AM-8PM PT. Can I change my FOX Nation plan? You may be able to change your package, changes vary by platform. If you purchased your subscription on the website, you may upgrade or downgrade your plan by clicking on “Change Plan” link under the “My Account” section. Promotional offers are available only to new and returning Fox Nation subscribers on qualifying Fox Nation subscription plans, may be redeemed only once per person/account, are valid only for a limited time, are subject to change without notice, and cannot be combined with any other offer, promotion or discount. If a free trial is offered, the subscription will automatically convert into a paid subscription at the end of the free trial at the then-current rate, unless you cancel before the conversion. Some free trials (other than verified Military and First Responder trials) will end immediately if they are cancelled. If a promotional discount is offered, the discounted subscription fee will be billed immediately. Subscription fees are non-refundable. By signing up, you agree to these recurring charges and accept the Fox Nation Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. Anna Paulina Luna, R-Fla., joins ‘Jesse Watters Primetime’ to discuss attacks against Tesla dealerships and growing criticism from Democrats against the Department of Government Efficiency. The Essex County Prosecutor's Office in New Jersey on Saturday provided an update on the shooting of two Newark Police detectives Friday night. Lori Vallow, the Idaho "doomsday mom" convicted of killing two of her children in 2019, said she believes she will be freed from prison in a new TV interview. Blue Lives Matter NYC founder Joseph Imperatrice joins ‘Fox & Friends Weekend’ to discuss the deadly Newark shootout that left one officer dead and another seriously injured. Rep. Henry Cuellar, facing charges of bribery and acting as a foreign agent, is on the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee’s “frontline list."

title: The Washington Post Accessibility Statement
content: View our Help Center’s guide to accessibility features and settings on the Washington Post website and mobile apps. At The Washington Post, access to information for all is core to our mission. We are committed to this ideal through not only our journalism, but also our engineering and design practices. We invest in tools and technologies to make this website and our digital journalism experience usable and accessible to everyone, including people with disabilities and those who use screen readers or other assistive technology/settings. Our efforts are guided by the World Wide Web Consortium’s Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1 Level AA. While we still have work to do, we have already incorporated a number of improvements to our online content, including the following: Accessibility is an organization-wide commitment, and we are excited to deliver an inclusive online experience. We will continue to work with our experienced website accessibility consultants to audit, and make further improvements to our website. If you experience difficulty accessing the content of this website, feel free to call us toll-free at 1-800-477-4679 or email us at accessibility@washpost.com. We will work with you to understand and address the issue.

content: Politics Vice President JD Vance is the obvious and prohibitive frontrunner, but here’s who else could be in the mix. Political gravity does apply to Trump after all, it seems. His move to dismantle the Education Department is merely the latest example of initiatives that Americans seem to strongly oppose. The key moments in a series of heated exchanges, and what it all means. It’s happened repeatedly in recent days, and Trump has sometimes taken exception. Anecdotes aside, polls show little sign of significant Trump voter backlash. But some warning signs of discontent loom. It’s the latest episode of Trump’s base quickly adopting his posture, despite the evidence. Their just-passed budget proposal pretty clearly requires cutting Medicaid, and that’s a big political problem. Martin, a Trump nominee for U.S. attorney, has blurred the line between prosecutor and political activist. His confirmation process will be telling. As their Republican colleagues avoid criticizing Trump like the plague, a handful have begun using some pretty strong words. Elon Musk’s threat to federal employees is the latest episode to call into question the White House’s downplaying of his authority. Provocative messages have become central to the Trump team’s political efforts, inviting everyone to guess what’s a joke and what’s not. New polling shows Trump’s approval ratings declining — and a number of major warning signs appearing. On the first big foreign policy test of the GOP’s obeisance to Trump, some lawmakers are obliquely distancing themselves from Trump. Donald Trump has long resisted criticizing Vladimir Putin, but now he’s apparently more than happy to do so with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.

title: Trump’s speech showed Democrats at low ebb. A comeback will take work.
content: Democrats are seeking cohesion in their opposition to President Donald Trump and a message that resonates with voters. The Democrats showed last week that presidential addresses to Congress are no place to formulate a resistance. Almost everything they did during President Donald Trump’s appearance highlighted weakness rather than strength. They had not one strategy but several. The sum was less than the parts. Many Democrats came away worried that their party is even weaker than it appeared after Trump’s victory in November, and for now, Democrats might be left to hope that Trump and the Republicans will make enough mistakes to offer them a way back. But that is only one part of a comeback strategy if Democrats are to become broadly competitive. The Democrats were handcuffed from the start Tuesday night as they sought to project the right amount of opposition. Too boisterous and unruly in their disagreements and they would embarrass themselves, playing into Trump’s hands and highlighting their powerlessness. Too passive and they would further anger their demoralized base that is looking for a spark of life from the leadership of the party. They were passive, yes, while trying to project mild resistance. In the House chamber, some Democrats held up ping-pong-size paddles with messages of opposition, discreet as to be ineffective. Some commentators likened them to a group of bidders at an art auction. Some women Democratic lawmakers were dressed in pink to protest Trump policies they say will hurt women and families. It was a sign of solidarity, but given how many people had filled the chamber, the symbolism by a relatively few probably was lost on those watching from home. The most dramatic moment came when Rep. Al Green (D-Texas) stood up and shook his cane at the president, charging that Trump has no mandate to make cuts in Medicaid. House Speaker Mike Johnson (R-Louisiana) demanded that he cease and desist, warning Green that he could be removed if he persisted. Green did persist and eventually was ushered out. On Thursday, he was censured by the House. Ten Democrats voted with the Republicans. Green’s protest was hardly the first such outburst during a presidential address to Congress. As President Barack Obama was speaking to a joint session about health care in September 2009, Rep. Joe Wilson (R-South Carolina) shouted out, “You lie.” His eruption was seen as a scandal, a breach of congressional decorum that shocked members of both parties. Wilson was condemned, and he apologized to Obama. But grassroots Republicans loved him for it. A week later, Politico carried a story with the headline “Joe Wilson: Right-wing folk hero.” With that Wilson moment, a descent had begun and has spiraled downward ever since. Year by year, these presidential addresses to Congress have been transformed from (sometimes boring) speechmaking to now Trump’s gaudy showmanship. A year ago, Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Georgia) repeatedly heckled President Joe Biden as he delivered his final State of the Union address. Biden so effectively parried her taunts and those of others that he came out a winner. Private concerns among Democrats about his physical and mental decline gave way to public comments about his energy and quick  ripostes. By summer, however, he was out of the presidential race, indicative of the lack of staying power from such events. By this summer, things may look worse for Trump and better for Democrats. On Tuesday, Trump effectively baited the Democrats into quiescence during the opening moments of his speech. They were so immobilized that they could not even respond with applause to a feel-good moment, when a 13-year-old cancer survivor named DJ Daniel, who has dreamed of becoming a police officer, was made an honorary member of the Secret Service and spontaneously embraced Sean Curran, the new director of the Secret Service. Individual Democratic elected officials have adopted different strategies for dealing with Trump. Sen. Chris Murphy (Connecticut) has been aggressive in calling out the president and his policies. So too has Gov. JB Pritzker of Illinois. Some Democrats have indicated a desire to find common ground with the administration when possible. But there is no consensus yet on the best approach. The state of the Democrats is made worse by the absence of a leader who enjoys national reach and recognition. Without a presidential nominee, that problem will prevail. Were Nancy Pelosi still the House speaker, many grassroots Democrats might look to her to lead the opposition. Neither House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (New York) nor Senate Minority Leader Charles E. Schumer (New York) has been able to fill that role. The road ahead will come in cycles, starting with the 2026 midterm election, followed by the 2028 presidential election. Beyond that, more questions will emerge about the party’s longer-term revival and whether  it can become more competitive in more places. Trump and the Republicans could play into the Democrats’ hands in the near term. The Trump team risks overinterpreting the mandate from the November election. The president’s leadership has been bold but also erratic: tariffs on and tariffs off, federal workers fired and rehired, budget savings overstated, Cabinet officers rebelling against Elon Musk. Economic uncertainty has pushed the markets down. All this has begun to affect the president’s standing, and his decision to mildly rein in Musk a few days ago was a sign of his concerns. Another political obstacle for the GOP will come as Congress moves further into budget season. House Republicans have adopted a plan that would require significant cuts to Medicaid. Republican leaders know the dangers. Either they throttle back and fall short of their promises to cut spending, or they go ahead and possibly inflict significant pain on Medicaid recipients; on the states, which share the costs; and ultimately on Trump and the party as a whole. Republicans may have forgotten the budget fight during the Clinton administration that led to a government shutdown in 1995-1996. Prodded by House Speaker Newt Gingrich (Georgia), Republicans wanted to reduce the size of government. Their plan included cuts in the projected growth of Medicare and Medicaid as well as other programs. Clinton resisted and won the political argument. That moment began Clinton’s comeback after Republicans had captured the House in 1994 for the first time in 40 years. The 2026 midterm will be shaped by this coming budget battle and by the success or failure of Trump’s other initiatives. Democrats will need an energized base, but success in 2026 won’t necessarily mean the party has been restored to good health. A victory could be little more than a reflection that midterm elections are more about the president and less about the opposition, and of the constant shifting in the balance of power in the House that has been the norm for almost two decades. The 2028 presidential election will offer Democrats still another opportunity to show what they learned from defeat last year. Parties are defined by their presidential nominees — and successful nominees, those who survive the grueling primary process and go on to win the White House, redefine their party. Clinton did that in 1992. Obama did it in 2008, though in a less definitive way. No one can say who will emerge to lead the Democrats in 2028. At this point in the 2008 cycle, Obama was already a rock star in the party and Hillary Clinton was nationally known and considered part of the best brand in the Democratic Party. At this point in the 1992 cycle, if Bill Clinton was known nationally it was more for delivering a too-long nominating speech at the 1988 convention. But Clinton was doing the intellectual work to reshape the Democrats into a post-Great Society party and developing a message to reflect that, though he experienced some bruising intraparty battles to get there. Today’s Democrats will have to confront culture war issues that have hurt them while developing an economic message that resonates with working-class voters who have shifted to the GOP. Notably, a few days ago, California Gov. Gavin Newsom came out against transgender athletes participating in women’s and girls’ sports, almost four months after Rep. Seth Moulton (Massachusetts) made a similar statement. Democratic strategists, wealthy donors and elected officials are at work trying to understand better the state the party is in. The party’s opposition to Trump currently lacks cohesion or consensus, but a comeback will not be won in the next 90 or 180 days regardless. It will take debate, disagreement and some unforeseen events before it’s clear whether Democrats are finding the formula. Follow live updates on the Trump administration. We’re tracking President Donald Trump’s actions by day, his progress on campaign promises, and legal challenges to his executive orders and actions. Trump’s speech: Trump addressed a joint session of Congress 43 days after his inauguration, outlining a message of defiant optimism for those who support him and gloomy despair for those who don’t. Here are seven takeaways from the speech and words Trump was the first to use in a presidential address to Congress. Federal workers: Trump targeted federal workers in his opening act — eliminating thousands of federal jobs in the first month at agencies, including: USAID, the IRS, the Social Security Administration, the Education Department, the Defense Department, health agencies, the National Weather Service and the National Park Service. Tariffs: Trump imposed a 25 percent tariff on goods from Canada and Mexico and an additional 10 percent tax on Chinese goods. China, Mexico and Canada announced they would retaliate with levies of their own. Here’s what could get more expensive with Trump’s tariffs. Trump’s advisers: Several of Trump’s Cabinet picks, including Robert F. Kennedy Jr., Tulsi Gabbard, Marco Rubio and Pete Hegseth have been confirmed. We’re tracking nominations here.

title: Politics
content:
On Friday’s broadcast of NewsNation’s “On Balance,” Rep. Jennifer McClellan (D-VA) claimed that the “only way” to enforce bans on biological men in women’s sports is for “people in schools to pull children’s pants down to determine what sex they On Friday’s broadcast of “CNN News Central,” Rep. Debbie Wasserman Schultz (D-FL) responded to California Gov. Gavin Newsom’s (D) comments on biological men playing women’s sports by saying that “we have to stand on principle and make sure that everyone New York Gov. Kathy Hochul (D) issued a state of emergency as several brush fires were reported as having broken out in Long Island on Saturday. Missouri won a $24 billion judgment against China in a coronavirus lawsuit on Friday after a federal judge ruled in favor of the Show Me State’s case accusing the Chinese Communist Party of hoarding protective supplies during the Wuhan virus pandemic. Korean filmmaker Bong Joon-ho says his new film Mickey 17 is not parodying Donald Trump with its villain played by Mark Ruffalo, but several critics say the allusions to the U.S. president are too numerous and too specific to deny. Vice President JD Vance criticized pro-Ukrainian protesters who had followed him and his three-year-old daughter around, noting that his daughter “grew increasingly anxious.” John Schnatter, the founder and former CEO of Papa John’s, spoke to Breitbart News Saturday about how President Donald Trump is the “perfect guy” that Americans need to “drain the swamp.” Alberta Premier Danielle Smith of the United Conseravtive Party told Breitbart News Saturday that Prime Minister Justin Trudeau set Canada back in tariff negotiations with America during a meeting with President Donald Trump at Mar-a-Lago. Ex-Georgia House Rep. Stacey Abrams said this week that she received $2 billion from Former President Joe Biden’s Environmental Protection Agency to greenwash home appliances in what some have likened to an alleged Democratic “vote buying” scheme. South Carolina State Sen. Matt Leber (R) has called for the termination of Charleston Library Board members over refusal to pledge to the U.S. Constitution, telling Breitbart News Washington Bureau Chief Matt Boyle that “there’s something just fundamentally wrong with someone who just refuses to swear an oath to the Constitution.” Rep. Scott Perry (R-PA) said that Republicans can defy history and expand their House majority if they deliver “meaningful” results and if Democrats continue to look “childish.” President Donald Trump’s America First trade policy has triggered a Canadian confidante of Hillary Clinton who coauthored a book with the failed presidential candidate. A member of Mexico’s National Guard pleaded guilty to using his position to help a car theft ring that was supplying vehicles from Texas to the Gulf Cartel in Mexico. President Donald Trump announced that he has nominated Amer Ghalib, the mayor of Hamtramck, Michigan, to serve as Ambassador to Kuwait. Un miembro de la Guardia Nacional de México se declaró culpable de usar su posición para ayudar a una red de robo de autos que suministraba vehículos al Cártel del Golfo en México. A Democrat lawmaker in Connecticut was arrested on Sunday and accused of driving under the influence of alcohol. A man from Laredo, Texas, is under arrest after Texas Department of Public Safety troopers allegedly caught him smuggling illegal aliens. The arrest followed a dangerous high-speed pursuit through a residential neighborhood near the state’s border with Mexico. More than 20 people were killed when Russia launched an attack on Ukraine overnight on Saturday, and officials said there may be more victims. On Friday’s broadcast of the Fox Business Network’s “Kudlow,” Secretary of Education Linda McMahon discussed antisemitism on college campuses and stated that there are “systemic issues” because “We keep seeing this over and over again,” and that “radical professors” and During the online “Overtime” segment of Friday’s edition of HBO’s “Real Time,” host Bill Maher praised the Trump administration for revoking $400 million in federal funds from Columbia University over antisemitism, but noted that the details of how the Trump On Friday’s broadcast of PBS’s “Washington Week,” Washington Post Chief Correspondent Dan Balz stated that the Trump administration stopping $400 million in grants and funds to Columbia University “is retribution and some measure of revenge against the people that he thinks Border czar Tom Homan is going to sanctuary cities such as Boston and “bringing hell with me,” he said during an appearance on Breitbart News Saturday. There has been “significant success” on the border, President Donald Trump’s border czar Tom Homan said. Illegal migrants know the “gravy train is over,” Trump border czar Tom Homan said during an appearance on Breitbart News Saturday. GOP Senators are demanding information from the Small Business Administration (SBA) about how much COVID-19 aid Planned Parenthood affiliates received.  Data from PEW Research shows that rifles of all kinds–including those Democrats label “assault weapons”–accounted for only four percent of U.S. gun murders in 2023. On Friday’s broadcast of HBO’s “Real Time,” host Bill Maher said that California Gov. Gavin Newsom’s (D) comments on biological men playing women’s sports are Newsom finally making the move to the center that Maher has wanted him to make On Friday’s broadcast of HBO’s “Real Time,” host Bill Maher reacted to suggestions that Democrats should shut down the government over their disagreements with the Trump administration by saying that whenever shutdowns are threatened, “it’s always the end of the On Friday’s broadcast of HBO’s “Real Time,” host Bill Maher agreed that President Donald Trump has been far more aggressive on getting hostages in Gaza freed than it appeared that the Biden administration was. ABC’s “The View” co-host and CNN Friday on FNC’s “Hannity,” Trump artificial intelligence and cryptocurrency czar David Sacks touted cryptocurrency as a store of value for the federal government. Russia on Saturday said its troops had retaken three villages seized by Ukraine in its Kursk border region in a fresh setback for Kyiv as the prospect of peace talks draws closer. Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk announced a number of new initiatives to bolster defence in a speech in Warsaw, as European powers appear set to comply with U.S. President Donald Trump’s demands that the continent pay for its own protection rather than relying on America. In a recent blog post, Federal Communications Commission (FCC) chair Brendan Carr outlined plans to vote on several proposals aimed at improving the reliability and accuracy of critical technologies, including GPS and 911 emergency services. U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) Homeland Security Investigations (HSI) agents carried out a workplace enforcement operation on Houston’s north side, leading to the arrest of 20 undocumented workers. The workers were taken to the Montgomery County Processing Center in Conroe, Texas. Polish abortion rights activists opened a centre across from the parliament building in Warsaw on Saturday where women can go to have abortions with pills, either alone or with other women. One of President Donald Trump’s golf courses in Scotland was vandalised by a group of “pro-Palestinian” protesters, defacing the property with graffiti and digging up the greens.  A scandal has erupted within Reform UK in Britain as one of its five MPs has been suspended and referred to police amid alleged threats of violence shortly after challenging the leadership structure of the party and leader Nigel Farage. During a portion of an interview with the Fox Business Network set to air on Sunday’s “Sunday Morning Futures” that took place on Thursday and was aired on Friday’s broadcast of “Mornings with Maria,” President Donald Trump stated that he On Friday’s broadcast of CNN’s “Situation Room,” Sen. Peter Welch (D-VT) argued that President Donald Trump should work with Democrats and Congress on tariffs and stated that “we’re supportive of tariffs on China. There’s a real trade imbalance there, and Leftist lawmakers in Britain have argued that being in possession of pictures of Muslim women without their hijab headscarves should be a crime akin to child pornography.

title: Entertainment
content:
John Dolmayan, drummer of the rock band System of a Down, said he voted for President Donald Trump and he’s glad he won. There’s going to be more “With Love, Meghan,” the Duchess of Sussex’s Netflix lifestyle series. Korean filmmaker Bong Joon-ho says his new film Mickey 17 is not parodying Donald Trump with its villain played by Mark Ruffalo, but several critics say the allusions to the U.S. president are too numerous and too specific to deny. Gavin Newsom’s (D) comments on biological men playing women’s sports are Newsom finally making the move to the center that Maher has wanted him to make On Friday’s broadcast of HBO’s “Real Time,” host Bill Maher reacted to suggestions that Democrats should shut down the government over their disagreements with the Trump administration by saying that whenever shutdowns are threatened, “it’s always the end of the On Friday’s broadcast of HBO’s “Real Time,” host Bill Maher agreed that President Donald Trump has been far more aggressive on getting hostages in Gaza freed than it appeared that the Biden administration was. ABC’s “The View” co-host and CNN John Dolmayan, drummer of the rock band System of a Down, said he voted for President Donald Trump and he’s glad he won. D’Wayne Wiggins, a founding member of the Grammy-nominated group Tony! Toni! Tone! behind the classic 1990s jams “Anniversary,” “It Never Rains (In Southern California)” and (Lay Your Head on My) Pillow,” has died. He was 64. Marlon Brando gets the credit he deserves for changing acting forever, but people forget he basically created the 1950s Beat Generation. President Donald Trump announced that Fox News’s Laura Ingraham and Maria Bartiromo will be joining the board at the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, adding that he looks “forward to restoring the Center to Greatness.” Authorities revealed the cause of death of actor Gene Hackman and wife Betsy Arakawa, whose partially mummified bodies were discovered last month at their home in New Mexico. Meghan Markle bizarrely corrected her friend Mindy Kaling — telling “The Office” star her surname is “Sussex” — in an episode of her Netflix series “With Love, Meghan,” sparking mockery from viewers. Sunny Hostin told her co-hosts Friday on ABC’s “The View” that President Donald Trump’s second term was an “existential crisis,” so Democratic lawmakers must be willing to “fight and die.” In what some may see as an ironic slap in the face, a street in Philadelphia is reportedly set to be named after actor Will Smith, who is native to the area. ABC late-night comedian Jimmy Kimmel revealed his impatience with the Democrats and mocked their pathetic attempts to reply to the Trump juggernaut as the president steamrolls them in his first three months on office. Singers Elton John and Brandi Carlile reportedly released a a self-professed “anthem for young gay kids.”  The Disney Grooming Syndicate has scrapped an expected lavish premiere of its live action Snow White remake to avoid all the bad publicity surrounding star Rachel Zegler. Director Osgood Perkins, whose independent films “Longlegs” and “The Monkey” have made massive sums on relatively small budgets, had some choice words about Amazon head Jeff Bezos when asked if he would direct the next James Bond. An NYPD detective has sparked significant outrage in her community for pole dancing in a G-string for a racy rap music video.  Take that, Donald Trump.  The View host Whoopi Goldberg revealed Thursday she has “no plans” to return to the Kennedy Center until it returns to “what it was supposed to be” in the time before the president took over. Stranger Things actress Millie Bobby Brown took to social media to address criticisms of her appearance. SANTA FE, N.M. — Authorities are set to reveal more information about an investigation into the deaths of actor Gene Hackman and wife Betsy Arakawa, whose partially mummified bodies were discovered last month at their home in New Mexico. Police officials in Texas say they have arrested one of the suspected killers of a popular Fort Worth, Texas, rapper known as G$ Lil Ronnie (Ronnie Sibley) and his five-year-old daughter. The arrest occurred at a Chevron station in Livingston on U.S. Highway 59 and Highway 190. NEW YORK (AP) — Roy Ayers, a legendary jazz vibraphonist, keyboardist, composer and vocalist known for his spacy, funky 1976 hit “Everybody Loves the Sunshine” that has been sampled by such R&B and rap heavyweights as Mary J. Blige, N.W.A., Dr. Dre, 2Pac, Mos Def and Ice Cube, has died. He was 84. A group of woke employees of entertainment giant Paramount have organized to sign a letter attacking the company for announcing that it intends to roll back its Diversity, Equity and Inclusion policies. Asian actor Stephen Park guest-starred on Friends nearly thirty years ago and says it was a racist environment. ESPN talker Stephen A. Smith continues to be the most vocal person supposedly not running for the Democrat 2028 Democratic presidential nomination. He told late-night host Jimmy Fallon that the Democrats lack a “national voice,” which has triggered his rise among Democrat candidates. Author and creator of the “Harry Potter” franchise J.K. Rowling railed against the transgender mob’s “unadulterated bulls**t” in response to a critic who tried to lecture her about “gender.” On Wednesday’s broadcast of NBC’s “Late Night,” Massachusetts Gov. Maura Healey (D) argued that “we need to get away from this caricature that’s been made of DEI, say the actual words, tell me what’s wrong with diversity.” And that Title LOS ANGELES (AP) — Actor Steve Carell is sending Southern California high school students affected by the devasting wildfires in Los Angeles to the prom for free. The popular musical “Hamilton” will be canceling its show at the John F. Kennedy Performing Arts Center following the Trump administration’s shakeup of the current staff. The Sesame Workshop will “downsize significantly” due to ongoing layoffs, said President and CEO Sherrie Rollins Westin on Wednesday. Kimberly Burch — the fiancée of Taime Downe, the frontman of the 80’s rock band Faster Pussycat — plunged from a cruise ship following a “heated argument” with the rocker, sending crew members on a frantic search which has since been suspended. Actor David Schwimmer, star of TV’s ‘Friends,’ is calling on Jewish celebrities to end their silence and stand up against antisemitism. More layoffs have hit the Disney Grooming Syndicate, a wipe out of about 200 jobs, which represents six percent of the staff in two major divisions. Tuesday, shortly before President Donald Trump delivered his address to a joint session of Congress, musician and entertainer Kid Rock offered Democrats some advice. Actor Mark Wahlberg told “Fox & Friends” during an interview on Ash Wednesday, that the start of the Lenten Season means “It’s a reminder that I need to do more, and I need to be better.” On a night of political theater perhaps not seen in U.S. history, with Democrats protesting President Donald Trump’s primetime address to Congress, several members walking out, shouting at the president, and Texas Democrat Al Green being removed from the chamber, actress Roseanne Barr said the spectacle marks an end for the Democrats.   The family of late cinematographer Halyna Hutchins have blasted “shameless” Alec Baldwin’s new reality TV show The Baldwins, filing a notice of deposition Monday demanding the actor “face the real-life consequences that he caused” and “face reality under oath.” First Lady Melania Trump attended her husband’s State of the Union (SOTU) address on Tuesday evening, opting for a low-key skirt suit from Dior.

title: Media
content:
Shedeur Sanders blames one institution and one institution only for the perception that his draft stock has slumped in recent weeks: The sports media. Charles Barkley has had it with “fools” in Canada who criticize hockey legend Wayne Gretzky over his friendship with U.S. President Donald Trump. ABC News president Almin Karamehmedovic appeared to be reading from a script and took no questions when he told the 15 employees at 538 that they were fired. Friday, during an appearance on MSNBC’s “Morning Joe,” long-time MSNBC personality Chris Matthews likened President Donald Trump to 20th-century Italian fascist dictator Benito Mussolini. The Human Rights Campaign, an LGBTQ+ advocacy organization, blasted California Gov. Gavin Newsom (D) for abandoning transgender athletes earlier this week in an interview with conservative activist Charlie Kirk. Stranger Things actress Millie Bobby Brown took to social media to address criticisms of her appearance. President Donald Trump told Breitbart News White House Correspondent Nick Gilbertson that he “loves” him and is familiar with his work during a press conference in the Oval Office on Thursday, showing recognition for his great coverage since Breitbart gained access to the presidential press pool. A group of woke employees of entertainment giant Paramount have organized to sign a letter attacking the company for announcing that it intends to roll back its Diversity, Equity and Inclusion policies. WASHINGTON–President Donald Trump on Thursday ripped into Democrats and liberal media pundits for their behavior during and after his joint address to Congress. A CNN poll found an overwhelming majority of viewers of President Donald Trump’s joint address before Congress on Tuesday thought Rep. Al Green’s (D-TX) outburst, which led to his removal from the House chamber, was “inappropriate.” Trump’s triumphant joint address to Congress Tuesday night attracted 13 percent more viewers than former President Joe Biden’s final State of the Union address. The father of DJ Daniel, the teenage cancer survivor whom President Trump honored on Tuesday, had harsh words for MSNBC host Rachel Maddow after she deemed the president “disgusting” for spotlighting the boy’s fight with cancer.  CNN was forced to issue a correction after the White House proved the far-left serial liars had published a fake “fact check” on President Trump’s claim about taxpayer money wasted on “transgender mice.” ABC News legal analyst Sunny Hostin said Wednesday on ABC’s “The View” that all the Democratic lawmakers should have walked out during President Donald Trump’s speech to a joint session of Congress. More layoffs have hit the Disney Grooming Syndicate, a wipe out of about 200 jobs, which represents six percent of the staff in two major divisions. White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt addresses the media on Wednesday, March 5. The Trump administration has rejected a $53 billion reconstruction proposal for Gaza by Arab states, calling it unrealistic due to Gaza’s “uninhabitable” conditions, Hamas’s control, and the lack of clarity on who would fund the billions needed for rebuilding. Los Angeles Times columnist Michael Hiltzik has written an article celebrating the South Carolina wildfires because he believes they mean California, no longer uniquely exposed to such fires, will not face conditions on federal funds. CNN host Kasie Hunt said during her network’s coverage of the presidential address to a joint session of Congress that President Donald Trump’s remarks were partisan, cruel and “incredibly divisive.” MSNBC host Nicolle Wallace said Tuesday on her network’s coverage of the presidential address to a joint session of Congress that she hopes the young man who survived pediatric cancer who wants to become a police officer does not commit suicide because of something like January 6 MSNBC’s Rachel Maddow said during her network’s coverage of the presidential address to a joint session of Congress that it was “disgusting” President Donald Trump “made a spectacle out of praising a young man who thus far survived pediatric cancer.” Sen. John Kennedy (R-LA) is taking aim at NPR and PBS in order to help taxpayers save their hard-earned money. A recent report by content licensing platform TollBit has exposed a significant disparity in referral traffic sent to publishers by AI search engines like those from OpenAI and Perplexity compared to traditional search engines like Google. Democratic strategist James Carville said Tuesday on CNN’s “The Situation Room” that President Donald Trump was “actively trying to destroy” the United States because it’s possible he “hates” the country. Microsoft promised in February it would disavow the censorship tool NewsGuard, yet NewsGuard is still listed in Microsoft’s Search Coach tool for children. Defense reporters invited by Chief Pentagon Spokesman Sean Parnell for an off-the-record meet-and-greet on Thursday broke ground rules and selectively leaked snippets from the meeting to columnist Oliver Darcy, who published their accounts the next day in his newsletter. MSNBC contributor Claire McCaskill, also a former Democratic U.S. Senator, said on Monday’s “Deadline” that the Oval Office meeting last Friday between President Donald Trump, Vice President JD Vance and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky was a heartbreaking “clown show.” Super Bowl champion, Pro Football Hall of Famer, and longtime Fox Sports analyst Jimmy Johnson has decided to retire after over 25 years at the network. The Mexican government is pushing a “Tough on Cartels” propaganda operation through U.S. media outlets while simultaneously protecting some of the country’s top, currently active, cartel bosses. Breitbart Texas reported extensively on the Mexican government’s exaggerations and half-truths about enforcement actions. Breitbart articles highlighted Mexico’s continued protection of leaders like the Cartel Jalisco New Generation boss, “El Mencho.” The New York Times fell for this PR strategy in a recent article, claiming cartels are in fear. Sunday, during his show’s opening monologue, FNC’s “Life, Liberty & Levin” host Mark Levin told his viewers there was nothing to be “giddy” about regarding Friday’s blowup between President Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky. As “El Presidente” of Barstool Sports, Dave Portnoy has seen more than his fair share of fights and disagreements. However, what he saw between President Trump and Ukrainian leader Volodymyr Zelensky on Friday made him think he was “watching Bravo TV.” The Washington Post is reportedly bleeding subscribers after its owner, Jeff Bezos, decided to switch up the newspaper’s opinion pages. The BBC is facing a potential terror probe after admitting to having paid a family member of a top figure in Hamas for a Gaza documentary. For the last decade, the establishment media have touted advocates’ claims that 15,000 transgender people are serving in the U.S. military. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky revealed that he was “not sure” he “did something bad” during his meeting with President Donald Trump, which resulted in him being kicked out of the White House. CNN chief international anchor Christiane Amanpour said Friday on “Inside Politics” that after the Oval Office meeting between President Donald Trump, Vice President JD Vance, and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky devolved into shouting that Russian President Vladimir Putin was the “only winner.” Thursday on FNC’s “Hannity,” ESPN’s Stephen A. Smith commented on his name being mentioned as a potential candidate for the 2028 Democratic presidential nod. Penn Entertainment CEO Jay Snowden has a dire prediction for ESPN Bet and its future place in the booming sports betting market.  Americans’ trust in the mass media has hit the “lowest point” in more than 50 years, a recent Gallup survey revealed. More video has been uncovered of CNN’s Jake Tapper actively engaging in the conspiracy to cover up Joe Biden’s mental and physical decline.

title: Economy
content:
On Friday’s broadcast of CNN’s “Situation Room,” Sen. Peter Welch (D-VT) argued that President Donald Trump should work with Democrats and Congress on tariffs and stated that “we’re supportive of tariffs on China. There’s a real trade imbalance there, and On Friday’s “Alex Marlow Show,” Breitbart News economics editor John Carney discussed his conversation with Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent. President Donald Trump on Thursday signed an executive order delaying his planned 25% tariffs against Canada and Mexico until April 2. President Donald Trump speaks at a White House Digital Assets Summit on Friday, March 7. The hiring of Americans apparently surged in February as more migrants left the workforce after President Donald Trump ended the Bidenomics policy of importing migrants for U.S. jobs. Rep. Tim Burchett (R-TN) warned Trump not to allow Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) savings to be spent by “war pimps.” The Department of Housing and Urban Development has announced an extension of its foreclosure moratorium for homes in the areas impacted by the Los Angeles wildfires.  Amazon’s AI tools and Google’s search snippet have demonstrated the downside of artificial intelligence with a bizarrely glowing review of Adolf Hitler’s Mein Kampf, calling the Nazi manifesto “a true work of art.” The Department of Veterans Affairs has cancelled a $56,000 contract it was paying to a “plant contractor” to water eight decorative plants. Mark Zuckerberg’s Meta is investing heavily in AI technology as it attempts to catch up to industry players like OpenAI. Now, the social media giant hopes that “hundreds of millions” of small businesses will embrace its agentic AI to reach new customers. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said Friday on CNBC’s “Squawk Box” that President Donald Trump’s tariffs were a “one-time price adjustment.” The Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) has fined Elon Musk’s Tesla almost $50,000 for alleged safety lapses following the death of an electrician at the company’s Austin factory last year. President Donald Trump signs executive orders and speaks to reporters in the Oval Office on Friday, March 7. Most Americans support the prospect of receiving $5,000 in stimulus checks from the federal government, polling shows. Secretary of the Treasury Scott Bessent called Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau a “numbskull” on Thursday, in response to Trudeau declaring Canada will continue a “trade war” with United States. Slightly weaker than expected California Insurance Commissioner Ricardo Lara has released the list of insurance companies that have agreed to give fire victims over 75% of coverage without making “the list” of their belongings. State Farm is not one of them. On Thursday’s “CNN News Central,” Rep. Gerry Connolly (D-VA) discussed the jobs numbers and stated that President Donald Trump and Elon Musk “created so much uncertainty about an economy that was strong when he was inaugurated,” and Trump “inherited a Speaking today before the Economic Club of New York, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent laid out the intellectual foundation of Trump’s economic vision, describing a comprehensive strategy designed to restore American prosperity and reclaim economic sovereignty. U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) Secretary Brooke Rollins told Breitbart News exclusively that President Donald Trump’s administration will be focusing its egg price reduction efforts on repopulation of chickens and on biosecurity measures, and that the administration is now ruling out any vaccines for animals against avian bird flu. The public does not like President Donald Trump’s plan to sell “Gold Card” citizenships to wealthy foreigners, according to a Rasmussen poll. President Donald Trump is working with House Republicans on a clean continuing resolution (CR) to give his administration time to advance his agenda, and his outreach appears to be working. President Donald Trump on Thursday paused tariffs on Mexican and Canadian goods that comply with the U.S.-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), granting a reprieve to America’s two largest trading partners. Trump signed an order modifying the tariffs he put in place earlier Walmart is telling its China-based suppliers to absorb the cost of President Donald Trump’s increased tariffs on Chinese-made products. Breitbart Economics Editor John Carney debunks the media’s fearmongering about Trump’s tariffs and explains why tariffs are a necessary tool to correct abusive foreign trade practices that have hurt American workers for decades. Socialist dictator of Venezuela Nicolás Maduro threatened on Wednesday to take “all necessary measures” to stop American oil company ExxonMobil’s operations in the Essequibo region, historically contested by Venezuela and Guyana. Google has begun testing a new AI-powered search tool called “AI Mode” that provides users with artificial intelligence-generated answers rather than traditional web links. Secretary of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) Scott Turner traveled to the Pacific Palisades on Wednesday evening to meet local residents and hear from them firsthand about their needs. President Trump’s tariff policies are a recognition that America cannot fix its economy without confronting the policies of surplus nations that have spent decades rigging the system in their favor.  Chinese Premier Li Qiang on Wednesday announced a 7.5 percent increase in military spending for 2025, ostensibly due to increasing tensions with the United States and Taiwan. President Donald Trump will exempt automakers from proposed tariffs on Mexico and Canada for one month after pleas from industry leaders. State Farm has chosen to ignore California State Insurance Commissioner Ricardo Lara’s recommendation that all insurance companies pay 100% of personal property coverage rather than asking fire victims to itemize all contents. A State Farm executive appeared in a video released Wednesday to say that homes should never have been built in the Pacific Palisades at all, blaming the victims of the recent Los Angeles wildfires, including State Farm’s own customers. China’s TikTok is reportedly profiting from sexual livestreams involving children, while the platform’s moderation policies are too weak to pick up on the explicit content, according to an investigation by the BBC. Tesla has experienced a dramatic sales declines across major markets worldwide, with experts linking the downturn to both increased competition and CEO Elon Musk’s political activities. The House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform has dragged the Democrat mayors of several sanctuary cities to a contentious hearing Wednesday. Apple has filed an appeal with the UK’s Investigatory Powers Tribunal in an effort to overturn a secret government order requiring the tech giant to create a backdoor for spying on encrypted user data.

title: London / Europe
content:
Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk announced a number of new initiatives to bolster defence in a speech in Warsaw, as European powers appear set to comply with U.S. President Donald Trump’s demands that the continent pay for its own protection rather than relying on America. There’s going to be more “With Love, Meghan,” the Duchess of Sussex’s Netflix lifestyle series. Alberta Premier Danielle Smith of the United Conseravtive Party told Breitbart News Saturday that Prime Minister Justin Trudeau set Canada back in tariff negotiations with America during a meeting with President Donald Trump at Mar-a-Lago. More than 20 people were killed when Russia launched an attack on Ukraine overnight on Saturday, and officials said there may be more victims. Russia on Saturday said its troops had retaken three villages seized by Ukraine in its Kursk border region in a fresh setback for Kyiv as the prospect of peace talks draws closer. Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk announced a number of new initiatives to bolster defence in a speech in Warsaw, as European powers appear set to comply with U.S. President Donald Trump’s demands that the continent pay for its own protection rather than relying on America. Polish abortion rights activists opened a centre across from the parliament building in Warsaw on Saturday where women can go to have abortions with pills, either alone or with other women. One of President Donald Trump’s golf courses in Scotland was vandalised by a group of “pro-Palestinian” protesters, defacing the property with graffiti and digging up the greens.  A scandal has erupted within Reform UK in Britain as one of its five MPs has been suspended and referred to police amid alleged threats of violence shortly after challenging the leadership structure of the party and leader Nigel Farage. First it didn’t exist, a dangerous conspiracy theory. Now it seems it may be the work of that government’s leading lights in the first place. Leftist lawmakers in Britain have argued that being in possession of pictures of Muslim women without their hijab headscarves should be a crime akin to child pornography. Russia said a partial or temporary ceasefire in its war on Ukraine would be “unacceptable” and launched a massive attack on infrastructure. UK backs U.S. push for Europe to do more on defence, its government ministers have said as the defence secretaries of both nations met.  The Disney Grooming Syndicate has scrapped an expected lavish premiere of its live action Snow White remake to avoid all the bad publicity surrounding star Rachel Zegler. The Holy See published an audio message recorded by Pope Francis on Thursday thanking Catholics and others praying for his health as the octogenarian enters day 21 of an extended hospital stay to treat a severe respiratory condition. Discovery of unexploded bomb halted services and caused cascading disruptions to scores of other trains. Former British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has admitted that his government was not in a position to actually fulfil his promise to the public of ending the illegal migrant crisis in the English Channel while expressing regret over the “stop the boats” slogan. Stranger Things actress Millie Bobby Brown took to social media to address criticisms of her appearance. France responds to Kremlin insults, which compared Macron to both Napoleon and Hitler, calling Putin in turn Hitler and an “Imperialist”.  Former Olympic snowboarder and Canadian national Ryan Wedding, 43, is on the FBI’s 10 most wanted fugitives list for allegedly running a violent transnational drug trafficking network. European Union (E.U.) leaders holding emergency talks in Brussels agreed Thursday to begin a massive increase in defence spending in the wake of President Donald Trump’s demands for less reliance on U.S. taxpayer largesse in hardware, funding, and intelligence sharing. New Zealand´s most senior envoy to the United Kingdom has lost his job over remarks he made about U.S. President Donald Trump. In the wake of decades of mass migration policies, almost one million people speak little or no English in England. Everyone asks can Europe endure Russian expansionism, but nobody asks whether Western civilisation can survive a nuclear armed Germany. Ugandan High Court Judge Lydia Mugambe, who sits on a United Nations criminal tribunal, made her first appearance in British court on Thursday to face charges of tricking a young Ugandan woman into serving as her slave while she studied at Oxford. The UK signals intention to not follow U.S. in suspension of aid to Kyiv hours before key meeting with Pete Hegseth. Author and creator of the “Harry Potter” franchise J.K. Rowling railed against the transgender mob’s “unadulterated bulls**t” in response to a critic who tried to lecture her about “gender.” Canadian Defense Minister Bill Blair said on Wednesday that Canada is open to sending troops to a “coalition of the willing” to protect Ukraine from Russian invasion. President Donald Trump’s administration is moving swiftly to revoke temporary legal status for upwards of 240,000 Ukrainians who fled to the U.S. after the war with Russia began, sources alleged Thursday. Kremlin poured scorn on the French Prez after his speech, accusing of everything from duplicity, to nuclear sabre-rattling, to bad manners. French President Emmanuel Macron said in an address to the nation on Wednesday evening that Europe should be prepared to defend itself and Ukraine without the help of the United States, a demand long made by President Donald Trump. President Donald Trump has made clear he wants Europe to be less reliant on U.S. military backing and be more self-sufficient. The message appears to be finally getting through with a day of emergency summit talks Thursday planned to examine ways to build capabilities. Ukrainian Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal says U.S military assistance is still flowing despite President Donald Trump’s pause order. South Korea and Poland have been strategic partners since 2013, with South Korea in recent years becoming a major supplier of weapons. Perhaps eyeing the chance for another incident the British and French leaders may offer to accompany Zelensky to Washington next time. Parties agree to loosen constitutional restrictions on borrowing, enabling 1 trillion euros or more on defense and infrastructure. Apple has filed an appeal with the UK’s Investigatory Powers Tribunal in an effort to overturn a secret government order requiring the tech giant to create a backdoor for spying on encrypted user data. The U.S. has now suspended military intelligence sharing until Ukraine chooses the path to peace, a report states.  Chrystia Freeland, a leading candidate to replace Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau at the helm of the governing Labour Party, has suggested that Britain and France could be called on to provide a nuclear deterrent against the United States. British defence minister will travel to Washington this week for talks with Pete Hegseth to advance work on peace in Ukraine. A local government council in England voted to ban Christian prayers from being held before meetings in a bid to promote “inclusivity”.        






 Copyright © 2025 Breitbart
